message_1: "A spacecraft travels at a velocity of 0.8c relative to an observer on Earth. What will be the relativistic mass of the spacecraft if its rest mass is 1000 kg?"
message_2:
To find the relativistic mass of the spacecraft, we can use the following equation:

relativistic mass (m) = rest mass (m0) / sqrt(1 - v^2/c^2)

where m0 is the rest mass, v is the velocity of the spacecraft, and c is the speed of light.

Given:
m0 = 1000 kg
v = 0.8c

We can plug these values into the equation:

m = 1000 kg / sqrt(1 - (0.8c)^2/c^2)

m = 1000 kg / sqrt(1 - 0.64)

m = 1000 kg / sqrt(0.36)

m = 1000 kg / 0.6

m â‰ˆ 1666.67 kg

So, the relativistic mass of the spacecraft is approximately 1666.67 kg.
